agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Juvenile Justice & Family Issues TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, March 13, 2019 PLACE: E2.012 CHAIR: Rep. Harold V. Dutton, Jr. HB 256 Moody Relating to the release on parole of certain inmates convicted of an offense committed when younger than 18 years of age; changing parole eligibility. HB 344 Dutton | et al. Relating to the age of criminal responsibility and to certain substantive and procedural matters related to that age. HB 452 Shine Relating to the creation of truancy masters for Bell County. HB 507 White Relating to a task force to coordinate and make recommendations on parent engagement and education programs provided by state agencies. HB 558 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to court-ordered support for a child with a disability. HB 559 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to written agreements incident to divorce or annulment. HB 1364 Wu Relating to the age of a child at which a juvenile court may exercise jurisdiction over the child and to the minimum age of criminal responsibility. HB 1689 Deshotel Relating to disclosure regarding the existence of a gestational agreement in a suit for the dissolution of a marriage and standing of an intended parent under a gestational agreement to file a suit affecting the parent-child relationship. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
